lines.text: Aye, you needn't think there isn't beauty to be found in Africa - beauty and terror.
They have a telegraph, though - drums. There's a sound that'll crawl up your spine and down to your gizzard. Maybe you'll hear it one of these days.
Aye, that's Africa for you. When you're not eating somebody you're trying to keep somebody else from eating you.
Don't you understand? White people must help each other.
Don't strain your gizzard, lad. She's a middling hefty lass.
Aye. A God-fearing race they are. Except, as you say, in the matter of diet.
